remarks: A variant on lexicographic order, which sorts first by some function of the base set, and then by a "backup" well-ordering when the function value is equal on both elements.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Mar-2013.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 18-Nov-2014.)
statement:
fnwe.1 $e |- T = { <. x , y >. | ( ( x e. A /\ y e. A ) /\ ( ( F ` x ) R ( F ` y ) \/ ( ( F ` x ) = ( F ` y ) /\ x S y ) ) ) } $.
fnwe.2 $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> B ) $.
fnwe.3 $e |- ( ph -> R We B ) $.
fnwe.4 $e |- ( ph -> S We A ) $.
fnwe.5 $e |- ( ph -> ( F " w ) e. _V ) $.
fnwe $p |- ( ph -> T We A ) $.
$d A w x y $.
$d B w x y $.
$d F w x y $.
$d R w x y $.
$d S w x y $.
$d T w $.
$d ph w x $.
$d w x y $.
$d w x y $.
